videopoker

Class VideoPoker

  • java.lang.Object
    • videopoker.VideoPoker
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    VideoPokerDebug

    public class VideoPoker
extends java.lang.Object
    class that makes possible to play the various commands allowed by the game: bet, deal, hold, advise, credit, statistics.

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VideoPoker(int credit, VideoPokerType type)
      Constructs a new Video Poker game, of a given type, initiated with a credit amount.

      this method gets the indexes of the cards that are advised to hold and returns them.

      With this method, you can place a bet on VideoPoker, with a given credit.
      protected void collectHand()
      this method gives to the deck the cards from the hand
      int credit()
      Returns the actual credit the player has

      this method gets the first five cards from the deck and returns them in the shape of a string

      this method adds the first five cards to the hand

      This method changes the cards on the indexes given in the parameter indexes with the cards on the top of the deck

      Returns an object of type statistics with the game statistics.
      protected void switchCard(int index)
      this method gives the card in the index given by the parameter index to the deck and substitutes it with the first card of the deck

    • Constructor Detail

      • VideoPoker

        public VideoPoker(int credit,
                  VideoPokerType type)
        Constructs a new Video Poker game, of a given type, initiated with a credit amount. In order to construct a new Video Poker, the programmer must first implement a VideoPokerType.
        Parameters:
        credit - Credit amount to initiate the game with
        type - Video Poker type implemented

    • Method Detail

      • bet

        public void bet(int bet)
         throws InvalidAmountException,
                InvalidGameStateException,
                InsufficientFundsException
        With this method, you can place a bet on VideoPoker, with a given credit.
        Bets can be only between 1 and 5 credits.
        Parameters:
        bet - Bet to be places
        Throws:
        InvalidAmountException - Thrown when the amount to bet is greater than 5 or lesser than 1 credits
        InvalidGameStateException - Thrown when the game state doesn't allow a bet
        InsufficientFundsException - Thrown when the amount to bet exceed the credit funds

      • quit

        public void quit()
          throws InvalidGameStateException
        Throws:
        InvalidGameStateException

      • credit

        public int credit()
        Returns the actual credit the player has
        Returns:
        credit

      • statistics

        public Statistics statistics()
        Returns an object of type statistics with the game statistics.
        Returns:
        Object of type Statistics
        See Also:
        videopoker.Statistics.java

      • hold

        public PlayResult hold(int[] indexes)
                throws InvalidCardIndexException,
                       InvalidGameStateException,
                       EmptyDeckEception
        This method changes the cards on the indexes given in the parameter indexes with the cards on the top of the deck
        Parameters:
        indexes -
        Returns:
        result hand and type of hand that result from holding
        Throws:
        InvalidCardIndexException
        InvalidGameStateException
        EmptyDeckEception
        See Also:
        videopoker.PlayReusult.java

      • advice

        public int[] advice()
             throws InvalidGameStateException
        this method gets the indexes of the cards that are advised to hold and returns them.
        Returns:
        indexes indexes advised to hold
        Throws:
        InvalidGameStateException

      • deal

        public java.lang.String deal()
                      throws InvalidGameStateException,
                             InvalidAmountException,
                             InsufficientFundsException,
                             EmptyDeckEception
        this method gets the first five cards from the deck and returns them in the shape of a string
        Returns:
        hand hand that was dealt and is to be shown
        Throws:
        InvalidGameStateException

        protected void switchCard(int index)
